title: Revitive: Leg Therapy
description:
THIS APP ONLY WORKS WITH A REVITIVE MEDIC COACH CIRCULATION BOOSTER.  
Get yours at www.revitive.com

How Revitive helps you?

Good circulation is essential for good health but aging, being less active, smoking and certain medical conditions, such as: Diabetes, Osteoarthritis, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, can all cause circulation problems. Symptoms of poor circulation, such as leg aches and pains, cramp or swollen feet and ankles can all be alleviated by using a Revitive circulation booster.

The Revitive Medic Coach stimulates the muscles in your legs and feet, using Electrical Muscle Stimulation (EMS) to increase your circulation.  Using the app, connected with the Medic Coach, you can create therapy plans tailored to your leg symptoms. Rosie, your virtual Therapy Coach, will help you stay on track and get the most from your therapy sessions.

The Revitive Medic Coach Circulation Booster uses unique OxyWave Technology to provide drug-free and clinically proven therapy for best results.

Revitive app features:

●	Rosie, your virtual Therapy Coach, developed to guide you during your therapy plans.
●	A training plan to help you use Revitive correctly.
●	10-week therapy plans, tailored to your symptoms and their severity.
●	Clinically proven Medic programme, a vigorous programme that delivers 2x more blood flow for relief from chronic symptoms.
●	Knee programmes with optional exercises, to focus on muscle strengthening, helping to support and stabilise the knee - designed for people with Osteoarthritis or knee-joint pain.
●	Body pad programmes, using Electrical Muscle Stimulation (EMS) and 	Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS), two proven technologies for use as part of your complete pain management.
●	Self-Guided Mode, so you can complete your therapy at your own pace.
●	Personal control of your stimulation intensity and time with a convenient controller.
●	Skin hydration sensors to check and advise on hydration levels, to make sure you are getting the maximum EMS to your leg muscles.
●	A motion sensor to coach you to your optimum therapy intensity by measuring the rocking movement of the Revitive Medic Coach device that occurs once good stimulation is achieved.
●	Regular check-ins to monitor your progress and key-symptom relief.
●	Integrated steps counter – links to Google Fit.
●	Easy-to-use therapy reminder settings.
●	Motivational awards to help you achieve your goals.
●	Easy access to support and safety advice.

Unsuitable for use if you are:

●	Fitted with a heart pacemaker or AICD
●	Being treated for, or have symptoms of an existing Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
●	Pregnant

Always read the device instruction manual and use only as directed. If you are uncertain about the cause of your symptoms or if your symptoms persist, please consult your doctor.

Android application uses Google Fit to fetch steps counter data.  This data is presented to the user in two perspectives:

●	Perspective of one week, where steps are shown on a daily level.
●	Perspective of 10 weeks, where the average value of each two-week period is shown

The goal of gathering steps counter data is to encourage the user to walk more, by visualising any improvement in their amount of walking.

Actegy Limited
Developer
descriptionHTML:
THIS APP ONLY WORKS WITH A REVITIVE MEDIC COACH CIRCULATION BOOSTER.
Get yours at www.revitive.com

How Revitive helps you?

Good circulation is essential for good health but aging, being less active, smoking and certain medical conditions, such as: Diabetes, Osteoarthritis, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, can all cause circulation problems. Symptoms of poor circulation, such as leg aches and pains, cramp or swollen feet and ankles can all be alleviated by using a Revitive circulation booster.

The Revitive Medic Coach stimulates the muscles in your legs and feet, using Electrical Muscle Stimulation (EMS) to increase your circulation. Using the app, connected with the Medic Coach, you can create therapy plans tailored to your leg symptoms. Rosie, your virtual Therapy Coach, will help you stay on track and get the most from your therapy sessions.

The Revitive Medic Coach Circulation Booster uses unique OxyWave Technology to provide drug-free and clinically proven therapy for best results.

Revitive app features:

● Rosie, your virtual Therapy Coach, developed to guide you during your therapy plans.
● A training plan to help you use Revitive correctly.
● 10-week therapy plans, tailored to your symptoms and their severity.
● Clinically proven Medic programme, a vigorous programme that delivers 2x more blood flow for relief from chronic symptoms.
● Knee programmes with optional exercises, to focus on muscle strengthening, helping to support and stabilise the knee - designed for people with Osteoarthritis or knee-joint pain.
● Body pad programmes, using Electrical Muscle Stimulation (EMS) and Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS), two proven technologies for use as part of your complete pain management.
● Self-Guided Mode, so you can complete your therapy at your own pace.
● Personal control of your stimulation intensity and time with a convenient controller.
● Skin hydration sensors to check and advise on hydration levels, to make sure you are getting the maximum EMS to your leg muscles.
● A motion sensor to coach you to your optimum therapy intensity by measuring the rocking movement of the Revitive Medic Coach device that occurs once good stimulation is achieved.
● Regular check-ins to monitor your progress and key-symptom relief.
● Integrated steps counter – links to Google Fit.
● Easy-to-use therapy reminder settings.
● Motivational awards to help you achieve your goals.
● Easy access to support and safety advice.

Unsuitable for use if you are:

● Fitted with a heart pacemaker or AICD
● Being treated for, or have symptoms of an existing Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
● Pregnant

Always read the device instruction manual and use only as directed. If you are uncertain about the cause of your symptoms or if your symptoms persist, please consult your doctor.

Android application uses Google Fit to fetch steps counter data. This data is presented to the user in two perspectives:

● Perspective of one week, where steps are shown on a daily level.
● Perspective of 10 weeks, where the average value of each two-week period is shown

The goal of gathering steps counter data is to encourage the user to walk more, by visualising any improvement in their amount of walking.

Actegy Limited
Developer
summary: Tailored therapy plans to relieve achy, painful legs; swelling and cramp.
